sec.p: 7–9 June 2012, Padova, Italy. The 36th Annual International Academy for Research in Learning Disabilities (IARLD) Conference. IARLD is an international professional organization dedicated to conducting and sharing research about individuals who have learning disabilities. For further information visit: http://www.iarld.com/.

14 June 2012, Rose Bowl, Leeds Metropolitan University, Leeds, UK.Nursing 2012: Care and Compassion. The aim of this year’s conference is to create a forum that reflects upon the concepts of compassion and caring in mental health and learning disability nursing from a historical and contemporary context. For further information visit: http://www.andrewsimscentre.nhs.uk/events/305/nursing-2012-care-and-compassion/.

10–15 June 2012, Easton, MA, USA.Fragile X and Autism-Related Disorders: From Basic Neuroscience to Improved Clinical Care. This conference will bring together leading scientists and clinicians in the Fragile X and ASD fields. Topics will include molecular genetics, model system characterizations, synaptic signalling and function studies, small molecule trials and clinical reports. For further information visit: http://www.grc.org/programs.aspx?year=2012&program=fragilex.

27–29 June 2012, Cork, Ireland. European Song Festival for people with an Intellectual Disability. The festival includes an international song competition, non-competitive performances with dance and drama groups, poets and other art forms, and a two-day conference on the arts and intellectual disability. For further information visit: http://www.esf2012.eu/.

3–4 July 2012, Milton Keynes, UK. Health and Learning Disability: Past, Present and Future. Organized by The Open University. This conference aims to find out more about the experiences of people with learning disabilities in relation to their health. The aims of the conference are to explore what people’s experiences of health and healthcare settings have been in the past and what are they like today; what are the barriers to good health that people with learning disabilities have faced, and how can these be addressed; and where health and learning disability meet in policy and practice. For further information visit: http://www.open.ac.uk/hsc/ldsite/conferences_v2.html.

5–6 July 2012, London, UK. 10th National Annual Autism Conference, Autism Today: Summer Meeting. This two-day event presents an excellent opportunity for all professionals working with individuals with ASD from the fields of both healthcare and education to update and extend their knowledge and skills. A carefully designed programme will provide participants with updates on research and expert insights. Topics include which diagnostic criteria should be incorporated into DSM-V; management of aggression and difficult behaviour; and speech and language therapy in management of ASD. For further information visit: http://www.mahealthcareevents.co.uk/cgi-bin/go.pl/conferences/detail.html?conference_uid=311.

8–9 July 2012, Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. International Association for the Scientific Study of Intellectual Disabilities (IASSID) Academy Workshop. A schedule of 12 workshops will be held in conjunction with the 14th World Congress of the IASSID (see next listing) over two days. The workshop programme has been developed by the Academy in consultation with various IASSID bodies and local constituent organizations. The workshops will involve international speakers on a variety of emergent and critical issues for the field of intellectual and developmental disabilities. Workshops include promoting social inclusion; family quality of life; effective interventions and service models in mental health intellectual disabilities; and intellectual disabilities and dementia – developing effective practices. For further information e-mail: Professor Roy Brown at royibrown@shaw.ca. Visit: https://www.iassid.org/conference/index.php/ACA/WCA/index.

9–14 July 2012, Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. International Association for the Scientific Study of Intellectual Disabilities (IASSID) World Congress 2012. This congress, whose theme is ‘A World of Potential’, will bring approximately 1500 delegates from around the world to Halifax. The conference will consist of more than 200 concurrent sessions in which presenters will share their recent findings, and will include approximately a dozen plenary addresses about major advances in the biological, behavioural and social sciences related to intellectual disabilities. For further information visit: www.iassid.org.

11–13 July (pre-conference 9–11 July) 2012, University of Linz, Altenbergerstraße 69, 4040 Linz, Austria. 13th International Conference on Computers Helping People with Special Needs. The conference will focus on educational issues, mobility problems, disability rights and issues associated with the ageing of our society. It is a forum for open discussion on complex issues and the exchange of cutting edge scientific breakthroughs to make the life of people with special needs more fulfilling. For further information visit: http://www.icchp.org/.

30 July to 1 August 2012, Leeds, UK.Hosted by Leeds Centre for Victorian Studies, Leeds Trinity University College. This three-day international conference seeks to address conceptualizations of disability in the Victorian period and their legacy(ies); and the ways in which we can draw disabled voices and testimonies together to construct ‘the long view’. For further information e-mail: Heather Jones at h.jones@leedstrinity.ac.uk. Tel: +44 (0)113 2837126. Visit: http://www.leedstrinity.ac.uk/Disability-Victorians.

1–2 August 2012, Jerusalem, Israel. ICare4Autism International Autism Conference. Brings together top leading medical and educational professionals and researchers working in autism. The purpose of the ICare4Autism conferences is to share current research into the causes and treatment of autism spectrum disorders. Speakers include Dame Stephanie Shirley, Dr Joshua Weinstein and Hugh Morgan. For further information e-mail: info@icare4autism.org. Visit: http://www.icare4autism.org/events/2012-international-autism-conference/.

9–10 August 2012, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.Victorian Autism Conference. Organized by Autism Victoria trading as Amaze. This conference will focus on providing families and professionals with practical strategies and information on autism spectrum disorders and will address topics from across the lifespan. Keynote speakers include Professor Tony Attwood, Carol Gray, Sue Larkey and Jonathon Petty and family. For further information e-mail: info@amaze.org.au. Visit: http://www.amaze.org.au/events-info/vac/.

29 August to 9 September 2012, London, UK. Paralympic Games. There are 20 sports in the Paralympic programme for the London 2012 Games. These include archery, athletics, rowing, judo, fencing and volleyball. Paralympic Cycling breaks down into two disciplines: road and track. During the London 2012 Games Olympic and Paralympic events will take place at venues in the Olympic Park, across London, and at out of London venues. For further information visit: http://www.london2012.com/paralympic-sport.

5–6 September 2012, Oviedo, Spain.LDW World Congress on Learning Disabilities: Second European Conference. Hosted by Learning Disabilities Worldwide. This is an annual international world congress for children, parents and professionals. The World Congress on Learning Disabilities brings together the most respected world leaders in the field of learning disabilities. For further information visit: http://www.ldworldwide.org/ldwr-world-congress-on-learning-disabilities.

8–9 September 2012, Brunel University, Uxbridge, UK. Treating Autism Conference 2012. Speakers include expert researchers and parents who have years of experience to share. Introductory information for new people and more in-depth treatment options and research for veterans and practitioners is provided. Participants can choose to attend one of three workshops held on 8 September; these cover applied behavioural analysis/verbal behaviour, relationship development intervention or intensive interaction. For further information visit: http://www.treatingautism.co.uk/events/565/save-the-dates-treating-autism-conference-2012/.

11–13 September 2012, Lancaster University, UK. The Sixth International Disability Studies Conference: Disability, Poverty and Neo-Liberalism. This conference brings together researchers, practitioners, policy makers and activists from around the world to share and debate research, ideas and developments in disability studies. Keynote speakers include Chris Gower, Rob Imrie and Kristjana Kristiansen. For further information visit: http://www.lancs.ac.uk/fass/events/disabilityconference/index.htm.

27–29 September 2012, Zagreb, Republic of Croatia. The 8th International Conference on Research in Education and Rehabilitation Sciences. This conference aims to provide an opportunity for the discussion of new topics in education, rehabilitation and similar scientific disciplines. Topics include: inclusive education and rehabilitation; behavioural disorders; visual impairments; mood disorders; chronic diseases; and art therapies. For further information visit: http://www.conference.erf.unizg.hr/index.php?lang=en.

17–20 October 2012, Sydney, NSW, Australia. 21st Congress of the International Association for Disability and Oral Health. This congress will explore the latest information and current research in this field. Congress speakers will foster meaningful discussion and debate amongst delegates which will, in turn, further the objectives of oral health care for the disabled. For further information visit: http://www.iadh2012.com/.

25–28 October 2012, Novi Sad, Serbia. II International Scientific Conference ‘Special Education and Rehabilitation: Cerebral Palsy’. Main conference topics are cerebral palsy, etiology and diagnostics; support of people with cerebral palsy; education of people with cerebral palsy; and social welfare of people with cerebral palsy. For further information e-mail: info at cerebralnaparaliza.com or visit www.cerebralnaparaliza.com/.

6–7 December 2012, Perth, Australia. ICDLD2012: International Conference on Developmental and Learning Disabilities. This international conference aims to bring together leading academic scientists, researchers and scholars to exchange and share their experiences and research results about all aspects of developmental and learning disabilities, and discuss the practical challenges encountered and the solutions adopted. For further information visit: http://www.waset.org/conferences/2012/perth/icdld/.
13–16 February 2013, San Antonio, TX. Learning Disabilities Association of America 50th Annual International Conference. For further information visit: http://www.ldanatl.org/conference/index.asp.

8–10 March 2013, Lucknow, India.International Conference on Cerebral Palsy and Developmental Diseases. The theme for this conference is ‘From Dogmas Towards Evidence’. There will be both pre-conference and post-conference workshops. For further information contact: Dr Vipul Shah. E-mail: vipulshak@rediffmail.com. Visit: http://www.indiancerebralpalsy.com/index.php?page=edu.

7–9 May 2013, Wildbad Kreuth, Bavaria.Professional Providers and Caregivers Conference ‘Specialized Training for Prader-Willi Syndrome’. This conference follows in the tradition of the previous three, building on the best practice model for caring for those with PWS in residential care. Speakers come from all over the globe to share, discuss, and work in collaboration searching for the best possible management tools needed for this challenging work. For further information visit: http://www.pws-caretakers-conference.de/.

6–9 June 2013, Milan, Italy.4th World Congress on ADHD: From Childhood to Adult Disease. For further information visit: http://www.adhd-congress.org/. The Final Programme will be published in April 2013.

17–21 July 2013, Cambridge, UK. IPWSO’s 8th International PWS Conference. Programme will include all the latest research about PWS including sessions especially for scientists, researchers, care providers, teachers, and parents. For further information e-mail: jwaters@pwsa.co.uk or visit www.pwsa.co.uk.

22–24 August 2013, Tokyo, Japan. International Association for the Scientific Study of Intellectual Disabilities (IASSID) Asia-Pacific 3rd Regional Conference. For further information visit: www.iassid.org.
9–11 September 2014, Lancaster University, UK. Disability Studies Conference. Further information to follow.

6–11 June 2015, Berlin, Germany. 8th World Congress of the International Society of Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine. Hosted by the German Society for Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation and the Austrian Society for Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. There will be leading experts in physical and rehabilitation medicine from all over the world. In the congress the most recent scientific studies in physical and rehabilitation medicine will be presented and discussed, and innovation in rehabilitation measures and technology will be the focus of the conference. There will also be seminars and hands-on workshops. Innovation of rehabilitation technology will also be presented in an extensive industrial exhibition. For further information e-mail: Jena at jutta.vach(at)conventus.de. Visit: http://www.isprm2015.org/.
6–8 September 2016, Lancaster University, UK.Disability Studies Conference. Further information to follow.
